B2B Sales Officer - Raw Materials Job at SAR Industries Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        SAR Industries Nigeria Limited is a part of the Givanas Group, a diversified Nigerian company involved in various industries. SAR Industries specializes in supplying raw materials to the soap, cosmetics, and detergent industries, among others.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: B2B Sales Officer - Raw Materials

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reporting To: Sales Manager

Job Summary
     

            
    




	SAR Industries is seeking a proactive and target-driven B2B Sales Officer to manage sales of imported raw materials(chemicals and industrial inputs) to manufacturing and industrial clients.
	The role involves identifying business opportunities, nurturing long-term relationships with clients, and achieving sales growth in the raw material distribution segment.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify and pursue new B2B sales opportunities within the manufacturing and industrial sectors.
	Manage and grow a portfolio of existing clients, ensuring repeat business and satisfaction.
	Understand client needs and recommend suitable raw materials and solutions.
	Prepare and deliver tailored proposals and quotations.
	Monitor market trends, competitor activity, and pricing dynamics.
	Negotiate terms, contracts, and pricing in line with company policies.
	Collaborate with the logistics and supply chain team to ensure efficient delivery.
	Provide post-sales support and maintain strong customer relationships.


Requirements


	Education: B.Sc / HND in Chemistry, Industrial Chemistry, Marketing, or a related field.
	Experience: 2–3 years of B2B sales experience in raw materials,industrial supplies, or chemical distribution.


Skills:


	Strong communication and negotiation skills.
	Good understanding of the manufacturing or industrial sector.
	Ability to manage client relationships and close technical sales.
	Proficiency in MS Office and CRM systems.


Benefits


	Salary: Competitive and negotiable based on experience.
	Exposure to a growing segment in industrial raw materials.
	Career advancement within the Givanas Group.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send your CV to: careers@givanas.com using "B2B Sales Officer" as the subject of the mail.

Assistant Chief Engineer Job at Hilton Worldwide




        
    

        
        Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For nearly a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands. Our vision to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day. And our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant Chief Engineer
     

            
    



Job ID: HOT0BWOW
Job Location: Murtala International Airport, Ikeja, Lagos.

Job Description


	An Assistant Chief Engineer is responsible for all maintenance issues within the hotel to deliver an excellent Guest and Member experience while performing daily checks, repairing equipment, and coordinating renovation projects.


What will I be doing?


	As an Assistant Chief Engineer, you will be responsible for all maintenance issues within the hotel, daily, maintenance checks, and repairing mechanical equipment to deliver an excellent Guest and Member experience. An Assistant Chief Engineer will also be required to coordinate renovation projects and develop emergency programs. Specifically, you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards:
	
		Responsible for maintenance issues within the hotel
		Perform daily checks around the hotel
		Conduct lift emergency release procedures as required
		Diagnose, maintain, and repair mechanical equipment within the hotel
		Ensure good relationships are built with internal and external customers
		Maintenance of all hotel fixtures and fittings to ensure they are in safe condition and take action when any unsafe situations arise
		Develop, implement, and direct all emergency programs
		Develop, implement and manage energy conservation programs for the property to minimize expenses
		Coordinate renovation bidding, define the cost and scope of the project, and oversee the general contractor and subcontractors to ensure quality work is performed cost-effectively
		Perform special projects and other responsibilities as assigned
		Responsible for the health and safety of the hotel
		Ensure monthly safety inspections take place and employees are trained accordingly
	
	


What are we looking for?


	An Assistant Chief Engineer serving Hilton brands is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members. To successfully fill this role, you should maintain the attitude, behaviours, skills, and values that follow:
	
		Advanced knowledge of building management/engineering
		Positive attitude
		Good communication skills
		Committed to delivering a high level of customer service
		Excellent grooming standards
		Flexibility to respond to a range of different work situations
		Ability to work under pressure
		Ability to work on their own
		Previous experience in a management role
	
	
	It would be advantageous in this position for you to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions:
	
		First Aid
		Vocational training in engineering or a similar field

Project Manager Job at Whassan Nigeria




        
    

        
        Whassan Nigeria is a fully owned Nigeria Company with over 40 years of experience in industrial catering services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Manager 
Job Location: Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking an experienced Project Manager to lead the planning and execution of IT infrastructure and cybersecurity projects across a range of client environments
	In this role, you’ll manage the full project lifecycle—from scope definition and scheduling to team coordination, execution, and delivery.
	You’ll work closely with technical teams, vendors, and clients to ensure seamless execution of projects that drive digital transformation, resilience, and innovation.


What You’ll Do


	Lead end-to-end delivery of technical projects across infrastructure and cybersecurity domains.
	Manage project timelines, budgets, resources, and risks using tools like Microsoft Project, Jira, or Asana.
	Coordinate multidisciplinary teams—network, systems, cloud, and security engineers—for integrated delivery.
	Serve as the main point of contact for clients: providing status updates, managing expectations, and resolving issues.
	Oversee vendor and contractor relationships, including procurement and contract management.
	Drive continuous improvement through lessons learned and project reviews.
	Collaborate with solution architects and support pre-sales activities where needed.


What We’re Looking For
Education & Certification:


	Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field.
	PMP, PRINCE2, or Agile/Scrum certification (preferred).


Experience:


	4–7 years of managing IT infrastructure or cybersecurity projects.
	Proven track record of delivering medium to large-scale technology projects on time and within budget.
	Hands-on experience with networking, servers, virtualization, cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure), and cybersecurity frameworks.


Skills & Qualities:


	Strong communication and stakeholder management skills.
	Excellent organizational and time management abilities.
	Comfortable managing both internal teams and external vendors.
	Client-facing with a problem-solving, proactive mindset.
	Willingness to travel occasionally for project deployments or client engagements.


Why Join Us?


	Be part of a fast-growing tech company making an impact across industries.
	Work with high-performing teams on complex, rewarding projects.
	Exposure to cutting-edge infrastructure and cybersecurity solutions.
	Career growth opportunities and continuous learning.
	Prime work location in Ikoyi, Lagos.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief cover letter to: recuritment@whassanng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
